CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 3 - Prohibition of torture (Article 3 - Expulsion) (Conditional) (Togo)

Turning to the applicant ’s arguments , ORG held that while the applicant ’s account of the flood and the tensions with the security forces in the camp were credible , the alleged threats by the police and the resulting fear of the applicant were not , and the fact that the police had apparently not used violence against the inhabitants of the camp was in contradiction with the applicant ’s statements . CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s request for the re - opening of the asylum proceedings . With regard to the newspaper article from “ FAC ” , it found that it was unlikely that a newspaper would report on events about food distribution in a camp for flood victims DATE after that occurrence . This conclusion could not be altered by the “ verification report ” , which was not a reliable source for establishing the authenticity of the article and any resulting danger of persecution for the applicant , especially taking into consideration that it had not been drawn up in the course of the applicant ’s proceedings , but for entirely different proceedings . Even if the article from “ FAC ” were considered evidence to support the applicant ’s story , it alone was not enough to outweigh all the other remaining inconsistencies in his account presented in the former proceedings .

CARDINAL . M.A. was interviewed for the first time by ORG on DATE . He stated there that because of the flood in DATE , his family had lost their house and moved to a camp for flood victims . CARDINAL . In DATE , the ORG High Commissioner for Refugees ( ORG ) updated his information on the international protection needs of asylum seekers from GPE . In DATE since , the report found that the situation in GPE had stabilised and in a number of ways improved . Reports of kidnappings and killings at TIME continued to be received but in substantially diminished numbers . There had been no fresh outbreaks of widespread violence . NORP The report confirmed that from DATE the Government had bowed to international pressure and tried increasingly to re - establish national dialogue among the government , the opposition and representatives of civil society , since such a dialogue was a condition for the re - instatement of economic cooperation with ORG .
